Dear Ms. Wyman:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in
CWLM, and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result in
compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (517) 899-6024.

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program statement.
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 4/8/25, a youth reported that a staff member was sleeping on
the job and telling female youth inappropriate things.
Investigation This information was disclosed by Youth A to Consultant during an
unannounced on 4/8/2025.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth A reported Staff 1 fell asleep two different times
during one shift. Youth A described seeing Staff 1 sleeping while
sitting in the beanbag in the classroom and sleeping when sitting
in the kitchen/living room area. Youth A stated she gave Staff 1 a
glass of water and told him to splash the water on his face. Youth
A reported Staff 2 was working at the time and also witnessed
Staff 1 sleeping. Youth A stated she believed this incident
occurred sometime late last year.
Youth A described Staff 1 talking about “creepy things” at bedtime.
Youth A stated Staff 1 told her there was an “entity” in the house
and the entity had scratched Youth B.
Youth A reported while in the parking lot after bowling Staff 1 told
her, “I don’t want you.” Youth A stated she did not feel
comfortable when Staff 1 made that comment. Youth A described
not knowing what Staff 1 meant by the comment.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth B reported seeing Staff 1 sleeping during shift one
time while in the living room. Youth B stated she believed it was a
few months ago. Youth B denied seeing any other staff sleeping
on shift. Youth B reported there was another staff working, she
could not recall what staff, and that staff woke up Staff 1.
Youth B stated Staff 1 would share “a lot of stuff we [youth] should
not know.” Youth B described Staff 1 talking about his mental
health issues, having hemorrhoids, his pee smelling, having ED
(erectile dysfunction), and how the job was affecting his
relationship with his girlfriend. Youth B reported “no one would
ask, he would just tell us.” Youth B stated Staff 1 would talk about
demons, monsters, and skin walkers. Youth B described having a
personal experience at the house when she was deep asleep and
feeling like something was pinching and biting her. Youth B stated
she told Staff 1 about her experience and Staff 1 told youth in the
house there was “something” in the house. Youth B reported she
was mad at Staff 1 telling other youth about her personal
experience.
2

Youth B reported Staff 1 “didn’t have good boundaries.” Youth B
stated other staff were aware, but Youth B was not sure if
anything was being done to correct Staff 1. Youth B stated Youth
A had a crush on Staff 1. Youth B described in a parking lot after
the most recent bowling trip, Staff 1 screamed at Youth A saying,
“I know you have a crush on me, but I don’t want you.” Youth B
denied any other staff hearing Staff 1 yell at Youth A.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on April 8,
2025. Youth C reported Staff 1 fell asleep several times during
one shift. Youth C stated she saw Staff 1 sleeping in the
classroom and in the living room. Youth C stated she could not
recall the other two staff who were working but reported one of the
staff woke up Staff 1.
Youth C described Staff 1 talking about voodoo, asking the Eight
Ball questions and showing the youths how to play Charlie -
Charlie. Youth C reported Charlie – Charlie is a game where the
word yes is at the top of a piece of paper, the word no is at the
bottom of the piece of paper and there is a pencil that sits on the
middle of the paper between the words yes and no. Youth C
stated in the game, someone askes a question then spins the
pencil to get the answer. Youth C reported Staff 1 taught the
youths how to play Charlie – Charlie “a long time ago.” Youth C
stated it was “kinda scary.”
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
April 8, 2025. Administrator stated the facility was aware of Staff
1 falling asleep and had concerns with his boundaries and what
he shared with the youth. Administrator reported Staff 1’s
behavior was being addressed and there was a Performance
Improvement Plan in place for Staff 1. Administrator stated Staff
1’s discharge date from the facility was April 1, 2025, with the last
day Staff 1 worked being March 29, 2025.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on April 10, 2025. Staff
1 denied ever falling asleep on shift. Staff 1 stated he would “rest
his eyes” but never fell asleep where he had to be woke up by
another staff or youth.
Staff 1 denied talking to the youth about his girlfriend or personal
issues. Staff 1 described having a good relationship with the
youth at the facility. Staff 1 denied telling any youth he did not
want them.
3

Staff 1 stated he talked with Youth B about “spells, spirituality and
higher mind things.” Staff 1 reported he told Youth B he had a
spellbook for beginners at home and was going to bring it into the
facility for her. Staff 1 stated he talked to a supervisor about the
book but was told he could not bring the book into the facility.
Staff 1 reported he could not recall what supervisor he spoke to
regarding the book.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Coaching/Staff Development
Session dated 08/29/24 identifying boundaries as an area
of concern. Coaching/Staff Development Session dated
09/30/24 identifying standards of conduct and boundaries
as areas of concern. Coaching/Staff Development
Session dated 11/22/24 identifying ethics, self-care,
boundaries and cultural competency as areas of concern.
Coaching/Staff Development Session dated 12/29/24
identifying enforcing house rules as an area to become
more comfortable in. Staff 1 completed Code of Conduct
training on 08/02/24.
• Performance Improvement Plan (PIP) for Staff 1 dated
1/27/25 documented improvement needed in supervision
of youth, being consistent with rules, following policy,
maintaining appropriate boundaries, and learning to say no
to youth when they ask to do things not allowable.
Periodic Review notes listed on the PIP between 2/2/25 –
3/29/25 for Staff 1 documented concerns with boundaries,
caught sleeping on unit, walking off shift and being relieved
of duty.
• Employee Separation Report for Staff 1 dated 4/1/25.
Discharge date listed as 4/1/25 and last actual day worked
as 3/29/25.
• River Oak Youth Center Youth Supervision Policy
documents, “Program staff shall maintain active
supervision of youth, including interacting positively with
youth, engaging in a full schedule of constructive activities,
closely observing behavior of youth and changes in
behavior and consistently applying the behavior
management system. Program staff shall be able to
account for the whereabouts of youth under their
supervision at all times.”
• River Oak Standards of Conduct 6.0 documents, “Staff are
always expected to maintain ethical and professional
behavior. This includes the expectation that staff are to
interact with youth in a manner promoting their emotional
4

and physical safety while incorporating trauma responsive
practices.”
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per Administrator and
youths’ interviews as well as performance improvement plan
documentation, Staff 1 was found sleeping while on shift and
lacked professionalism by discussing personal interests/issues
with the youth.
Technical Assistance:
Technical Assistance was offered to the facility to continue to
document in coaching/staff development notes and performance
improvement plans identified concerns with a staff member. The
facility was aware of the concerns with Staff 1 and were
addressing the concerns and expectations for improvement prior
to the investigation.
Conclusion Violation Established
